alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Elbert and eastern Arapahoe Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 328 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Kiowa, or 35 miles southeast of Denver, moving northeast at 15 mph. Other storms were developing northeastward toward Deer Trail and Byers. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding of low lying areas possible. Locations impacted include... Deer Trail and Byers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
